ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Admittedly, I don't think this course works well for students who aren't likely to be resource managers or working in the field. Most of the concepts were beyond my understanding since I tend to focus on policy-oriented issues and management structures which weren't addressed as in-depth as I would have hoped.

12. In my view, this course can change the way the whole world uses its resources and how countries can develop with whatever resource they have or do not have. I recommend taking this for any one interested in forest and natural resources management.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Peer projects were interesting.
The knowledge and experiences that the professor bring to the class is amazing
Both the professor and the TA are friendly and patient.
The homework excercises where the most valuable learning tool for me.
Using the tools in the class to see how societies could be changed to better outcomes.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The lectures felt a bit all over the place. Course could benefit from a bit more structured approach to lesson-planning.

My understanding is that Chad is on sabbatical next year and soon retiring but if not, this class needs a major update with a strong, structured syllabus and class exercises that don't take about 24 hours of group work to complete.
i think that class should consider using Canvas instead of classesV2. the canvas interface organizes materials better
Clear logical chains and handouts should be presented in every class.
Need to try out a field trip to make the course impact clearer.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The class exercises is where most of the learning occurs and very rarely connect with the lectures.
Very okay and he was very helpful

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Anyone would like to learn about managing a resource
It introduces what management is and lets me know how difficult it will be, so it's significant for my program.
Being an MEM and aiming to work in extractive industries this class was a great fit.
Very relevant

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: The skills needed to "manage resources" seem useful and necessary in theory but this class doesn't touch on them with any sort of depth or structure to help you learn them.
I like the professor way of teaching and the knowledge and experiences that he disseminates. It also fit with my water focus
I thought it would fit my program.
I took this class because I want to help governments and policy makers make better decisions given the resources available to them.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: No.
Yes,it did
It's different but more than my expectations.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The group exercises were so demanding that it was hard to coordinate the needed time with so many schedules.
I gained much more insight from working in a ground and understood concepts better. Work was also done much faster
The group work is tough, especially when the group member also has little knowledge about the tasks. But it at the same time benefits my patience and abilities.
Information wasnt always at hand. Working in groups was ideal to come up with solutions to the excercises.
It was helpful to think through the exercises as a group and create a design together.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: I can't recommend this class for policy-focused students unless the lecture structure changes. For MF or MFS students this might be a bit more helpful.
Its a good course for anyone who thinks of going into natural resources management
Please find group members who have knowledge and skills complementary for you.
Be ready to carryout exercises with some tools
